{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3560145,"name":"Jackson Case","username":"NO_skcaj","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/f07891/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-18T03:33:13.431Z","cooked":"

Hey! I’m having issues with running Kotlin. I’m using both Vs Code and Intellij to run the code, they both build perfectly, but when I try to simulate it gives this error:

${env:HALSIM_EXTENSIONS}='C:\Users\3824\Documents\Programming\Robo\Competition2025Kotlin\build\jni\release\halsim_gui.dll;'; ${env:PATH}='C:\Users\3824\Documents\Programming\Robo\Competition2025Kotlin\build\jni\release;C:\WINDOWS\system32\'; & 'C:\Users\Public\wpilib\2025\jdk\bin\java.exe' '-agentlib:jdwp=transport=dt_socket,server=n,suspend=y,address=localhost:57199' '@C:\Users\3824\AppData\Local\Temp\cp_b1nlrsaaboemabfqzsp1f8edn.argfile' 'org.team3824.frc2025.Main' 

Error: Could not find or load main class org.team3824.frc2025.MainKt
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.team3824.frc2025.MainKt

I’m assuming that this is a problem with my build.gradle, but I’m relatively new to Gradle and Kotlin. It’s likely something stupid that I missed.

This is our code: GitHub - NO-skcaj/Competition2025Kotlin: PoC for Kotlin
There are some other problems with the code, but it shouldn’t affect it running (eg a command or two that does nothing, and us doing our own swerve math).

Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-03-18T03:33:13.431Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":28,"reads":38,"readers_count":37,"score":147.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":496007,"topic_slug":"issues-with-building-simulating-kotlin","display_username":"Jackson Case","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/NO-skcaj/Competition2025Kotlin","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - NO-skcaj/Competition2025Kotlin: PoC for Kotlin","clicks":7}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66400,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"silly programmer"},"post_url":"/t/issues-with-building-simulating-kotlin/496007/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3560147,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-18T03:36:36.788Z","cooked":"

In build.gradle line 13, you set ROBOT_MAIN_CLASS = "org.team3824.frc2025.MainKt", but your source tree has a Main.kt, not a MainKt.kt. So you need to change build.gradle or rename the class in the source tree.

Hey Peter!
I changed line 13 to "def ROBOT_MAIN_CLASS = “org.team3824.frc2025.Main” "
and it gave me a similar error:

PS C:\Users\3824\Documents\Programming\Robo\Competition2025Kotlin>  ${env:HALSIM_EXTENSIONS}='C:\Users\3824\Documents\Programming\Robo\Competition2025Kotlin\build\jni\release\halsim_gui.dll;'; ${env:PATH}='C:\Users\3824\Documents\Programming\Robo\Competition2025Kotlin\build\jni\release;C:\WINDOWS\system32\'; & 'C:\Users\Public\wpilib\2025\jdk\bin\java.exe' '-agentlib:jdwp=transport=dt_socket,server=n,suspend=y,address=localhost:57199' '@C:\Users\3824\AppData\Local\Temp\cp_b1nlrsaaboemabfqzsp1f8edn.argfile' 'org.team3824.frc2025.Main' 
Error: Could not find or load main class org.team3824.frc2025.Main
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.team3824.frc2025.Main
PS C:\Users\3824\Documents\Programming\Robo\Competition2025Kotlin>  c:; cd 'c:\Users\3824\Documents\Programming\Robo\Competition2025Kotlin'; ${env:HALSIM_EXTENSIONS}='C:\Users\3824\Documents\Programming\Robo\Competition2025Kotlin\build\jni\release\halsim_gui.dll;'; ${env:PATH}='C:\Users\3824\Documents\Programming\Robo\Competition2025Kotlin\build\jni\release;C:\WINDOWS\system32\'; & 'C:\Users\Public\wpilib\2025\jdk\bin\java.exe' '-agentlib:jdwp=transport=dt_socket,server=n,suspend=y,address=localhost:57631' '@C:\Users\3824\AppData\Local\Temp\cp_b1nlrsaaboemabfqzsp1f8edn.argfile' 'org.team3824.frc2025.Main' 
Error: Could not find or load main class org.team3824.frc2025.Main
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.team3824.frc2025.Main

I thought the same thing earlier but there was this weird comment on an example I was referencing where it used a @file:JvmName(“Main”) to avoid using “MainKt”. I have previously tried both, and they both produced similar errors.

You’re correct, StackOverflow says you need the “Kt” suffix. Hmm. Not sure what’s going on. Hopefully some other team that uses Kotlin can chime in.

NO_skcaj:

I thought the same thing earlier but there was this weird comment on an example I was referencing where it used a @file:JvmName(“Main”) to avoid using “MainKt”. I have previously tried both, and they both produced similar errors.

Starting your Main.kt file with @file:JvmName("Main") should let you use org.team3824.frc2025.Main as your ROBOT_MAIN_CLASS name.

That being said, I can run ./gradlew simulateJava no fine with your project as is
